sourcesContent:
import React, { Component } from 'react' import { connect } from 'react-redux' import Navbar from '../Common/Navbar' import { changeStatus, viewTicket, getComment, addComment } from '../../Redux/action' class ChangeStat extends Component { constructor(props) { super(props) this.state = { ticket_id: '', status: '' } } handleClick = () => { const {changeStatus, loginSuccess} = this.props changeStatus(this.state) console.log(loginSuccess) viewTicket(loginSuccess.id) } render() { const { view_ticket, match } = this.props const data = view_ticket.find(item => item.id === Number(match.params.id)) return ( <>
Ticket :{data.title}

Cagegory :{data.category}

Priority :{data.priority}

Ticket Information
{data.title}

Company Name : {data.company}

Status : {data.status}
Category : {data.category}
{ getComments && getComments.map(item => (
{ this.props.loginSuccess.role === "user" ? {item.comment_by === "user" ? this.props.loginSuccess.name : "company"} : "" } { this.props.loginSuccess.role === "company" ? {item.comment_by === "company" ? "you" : "user"} : "" } {item.comment_time}
{item.comment}
))}
) } } const mapStateToProps = state => ({ view_ticket: state.view_ticket, loginSuccess: state.loginSuccess, }); const mapDispatchToProps = dispatch => ({ changeStatus: payload => dispatch(changeStatus(payload)), viewTicket: payload => dispatch(viewTicket(payload)), getComment: payload => dispatch(getComment(payload)), addComment:payload => dispatch(addComment(payload)) }); export default connect( mapStateToProps, mapDispatchToProps )(ChangeStat);
